text:
Hi, I switched to vscode from juno an I am wondering, how can I profile my code similarly to how it was done in Juno.
<http://docs.junolab.org/stable/assets/profiler.png>
Is there a way to display, how long each line took?
Another feature I used was the graph, where I saw how long something took + I remember the red blocks were a sign of something bad happening (sorry, havent been using Julia lately - it was something with dispatch right? :])

elements.text: Hi, I switched to vscode from juno an I am wondering, how can I profile my code similarly to how it was done in Juno.

Is there a way to display, how long each line took?
Another feature I used was the graph, where I saw how long something took + I remember the red blocks were a sign of something bad happening (sorry, havent been using Julia lately - it was something with dispatch right? :])

text:
The red blocks were dynamic dispatch IIRC

There is some profiling in VS Code, you can see more about it here: <https://www.julia-vscode.org/docs/stable/release-notes/v0_17/#Profile-viewing-support-1>
